title: Feds say Everett ‘notified’ them of 13-year-old’s arrest as mayor denies city called ICE
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The Department of Homeland Security said the boy has ties to a Brazilian crime ring and has racked up a string of charges in Massachusetts.
Demonstrators protest during a rally outside Everett City Hall after a 13-year-old boy was arrested by Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents in Everett.
Barry Chin/Boston Globe Staff By Abby Patkin October 17, 2025 | 3:01 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Wu to deliver first-ever ‘State of the Schools’ address
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News In place of an annual speech to Boston's business community, Mayor Michelle Wu will deliver an address at the Josiah Quincy Upper School in Chinatown later this month.
Boston Mayor Michelle Wu and Superintendent Mary Skipper read to a class of second graders in Mattapan in September.
Jessica Rinaldi/Boston Globe Boston Mayor Michelle Wu is planning to deliver the first ever “State of the Schools” address later this month, she announced.

title: Realty group’s plan to install plate readers in Brookline sparks privacy concerns
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The ACLU of Massachusetts warns that the surveillance technology could expose residents’ movements far beyond the town’s borders.
A Flock camera on display.
Handout ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Marco Sturm doesn’t want to talk about silver linings after Bruins fall to Vegas
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins “That's not our standard.
We just got to be way better.
" Marco Sturm wasn't encouraged by Boston's performance on Thursday.

title: Patriots assistants point to Mike Vrabel’s value on family for why they joined him in New England
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: New England Patriots “He’s raised two boys, always asking about my daughter, and cares about just our lives outside of football.
" Mike Vrabel and the Patriots against the Saints last Sunday (Maria Lysaker/AP Photo).
Sunday’s Patriots-Titans game might be a revenge game for Mike Vrabel, but he isn’t the only member of New England’s coaching staff who is returning to a place they once called home.

title: Former Boston City Councilor Tania Fernandes Anderson to begin prison sentence
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Crime Fernandes Anderson resigned in disgrace after pleading guilty to charges related to her orchestration of an illegal kickback scheme.
Former Boston City Councilor Tania Fernandes Anderson stops to talk with the media as she departs the John J.
Moakley Courthouse in September.

title: Report: 5 of the country’s most expensive zip codes are in Massachusetts
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Real Estate Connecticut and New Hampshire also made the list, with Connecticut contributing a record seven zip codes.
The Boston skyline in 2024.
David L.

title: A Whitey Bulger mugshot is hanging in a Dorchester restaurant — here’s what 1,000 readers think
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Readers Say “Like it or not, Bulger was a part of Boston history, and he should be remembered for the rat that he was.
" The interior decor of Savin Bar & Kitchen, showing a photo of Whitey Bulger, is photographed in Boston, MA, on Thursday October 9, 2025.
(Pat Greenhouse/Boston Globe Staff) ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Wondering what ‘After the Hunt’ is really about? Me too.
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Movie Reviews Luca Guadagnino's #MeToo movie starring Julia Roberts, Ayo Edebiri, and Andrew Garfield prioritizes style and provocation over substance.
Ayo Edebiri, left, as Maggie and Julia Roberts as Alma in “After the Hunt.
” Yannis Drakoulidis/Amazon By Kevin Slane October 17, 2025 | 11:08 AM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Eagles reportedly telling teams they aren’t trading rumored Patriots target A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Morning Sports Update Brown has been rumored to be a possible trade target for the Patriots, as he's expressed displeasure over what's happening in Philadelphia.
A.
J.
